intro: Euphrasia danica, commonly known as the Danish eyebright, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive glandular appearance. Euphrasia danica is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
